intro: Schoeberia ramosa, commonly known as the branched sandmat, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its sprawling growth habit and hairy, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in dense, spike-like inflorescences. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid environments. Schoeberia ramosa is often found in desert scrub and chaparral habitats.
